alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:22AM CDT until May 06 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Marmaton River at Fort Scott affecting Bourbon County. .Heavy rainfall received yesterday and early today combined with additional rainfall expected through today will lead to river rises. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marmaton River at Fort Scott. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, minor flooding begins along Mill Creek north of town due to backwater effects of the Marmaton River. Flood waters also spill across the field by the Red Barn Restaurant, on the north side of town, at the new Highway 69 Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 35.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 38.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Fri 1pm 1am 1pm Marmaton River Basin Fort Scott 38.0 35.9 Thu 9am 38.4 37.0 35.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Friday morning at 930 AM CDT.
